1.name: Mary Poppins
1.description: In turn of the century London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

2.name: The Night of the Iguana
2.description: A defrocked Episcopal clergyman leads a bus-load of middle-aged Baptist women on a tour of the Mexican coast and comes to terms with the failure haunting his life.

3.name: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
3.description: An insane general triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a War Room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

4.name: Dear Heart
4.description: Single and alone, Evie arrives in New York for the annual Postmasters' convention. Staying at her hotel is a womanising salesman newly promoted to his marketing department and trying to ...                See full summary »

5.name: Per un pugno di dollari
5.description: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

6.name: Goldfinger
6.description: While investigating a gold magnate's smuggling, James Bond uncovers a plot to contaminate the Fort Knox gold reserve.

7.name: My Fair Lady
7.description: Snobbish phonetics Professor Henry Higgins (Sir Rex Harrison) agrees to a wager that he can make flower girl Eliza Doolittle (Audrey Hepburn) presentable in high society.

8.name: The Train
8.description: In 1944, a German colonel loads a train with French art treasures to send to Germany. The Resistance must stop it without damaging the cargo.

9.name: Zulu
9.description: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

10.name: The Gorgon
10.description: In the early twentieth century, a Gorgon takes human form and terrorizes a small European village by turning its citizens to stone.

11.name: Marnie
11.description: Mark marries Marnie although she is a habitual thief and has serious psychological problems, and tries to help her confront and resolve them.

12.name: A Shot in the Dark
12.description: Inspector Jacques Clouseau investigates the murder of Mr. Benjamin Ballon's driver at a country estate.

13.name: A Hard Day's Night
13.description: Over two "typical" days in the life of The Beatles, the boys struggle to keep themselves and Sir Paul McCartney's mischievous grandfather in check while preparing for a live television performance.

14.name: Il deserto rosso
14.description: In an industrial area, Giuliana, an unstable woman, attempts to cope with life by starting an affair with a co-worker at the plant her husband manages.

15.name: Carry On Cleo
15.description: Two Britons are captured and enslaved by invading Romans and taken to Rome. Hengist Pod creates useless inventions, while Horsa is a brave and cunning fighter. One of their first encounters...                See full summary »

16.name: The Third Secret
16.description: The first secret is what we don't tell people, the second secret is what we don't tell ourselves, and the third secret is the truth. The death of a psychologist is investigated by his teenage daughter and a former patient.

17.name: Kaidan
17.description: A collection of four Japanese folk tales with supernatural themes.

18.name: Mosura tai Gojira
18.description: A greedy developer unwittingly hatches a gigantic baby moth upon Tokyo, while Godzilla strikes once again.

19.name: Suna no onna
19.description: An entomologist on vacation is trapped by local villagers into living with a woman whose life task is shoveling sand for them.

20.name: Alexis Zorbas
20.description: An uptight English writer travelling to Crete, on a matter of business, finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.

21.name: Onibaba
21.description: Two women kill samurai and sell their belongings for a living. While one of them is having an affair with their neighbor, the other woman meets a mysterious samurai wearing a bizarre mask.

22.name: Les parapluies de Cherbourg
22.description: A young woman separated from her lover by war faces a life-altering decision.

23.name: The Masque of the Red Death
23.description: A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land.

24.name: 6 donne per l'assassino
24.description: A masked, shadowy killer brutally murders the models of a scandalous fashion house in Rome.

25.name: Father Goose
25.description: During World War II, a man persuaded to live on an isolated island and spot aircraft finds himself responsible for a teacher and several students, all female.

26.name: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
26.description: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness after the arrival of a lost relative.

27.name: The Last Man on Earth
27.description: When a disease turns all of humanity into the living dead, the last man on earth becomes a reluctant vampire hunter.

28.name: The Fall of the Roman Empire
28.description: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis, in which the deceased emperor's son, Commodus, demonstrates that he is unwilling to let anything undermine his claim to the Roman Empire.

29.name: The Killers
29.description: Surprised that their contract victim didn't try to run away from them, two professional hit men try to find out who hired them and why.

30.name: Strait-Jacket
30.description: After a twenty-year stay at an asylum for a double murder, a mother returns to her estranged daughter where suspicions arise about her behavior.

31.name: Sex and the Single Girl
31.description: A womanizing reporter for a sleazy tabloid magazine impersonates his hen-pecked neighbor in order to get an expose on renowned psychologist Helen Gurley Brown.

32.name: The Long Ships
32.description: A vagabond Viking adventurer and a Moor both compete to find "The Mother of All Voices", a legendary golden bell near the Pillars of Hercules.

33.name: The Pawnbroker
33.description: A Jewish pawnbroker, victim of Nazi persecution, loses all faith in his fellow man until he realizes too late the tragedy of his actions.

34.name: Bedtime Story
34.description: Two scam artists prey on women for their money. They clash in a Mediterranean hot spot. Will the cultured, high-class con artist come out on top, or will the rough small-change scammer rise to win the wager?

35.name: What a Way to Go!
35.description: A four-time widow discusses her four marriages, in which all of her husbands became incredibly rich and died prematurely because of their drive to be rich.

36.name: Seven Days in May
36.description: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.

37.name: The Quick Gun
37.description: Gunslinger Clint Cooper returns to his hometown to help fight off a raid by his former gang.

38.name: Becket
38.description: King Henry II of England comes to terms with his affection for his close friend and confidant Thomas Becket, who finds his true honor by observing God's divine will rather than the King's.

39.name: Matrimonio all'italiana
39.description: The rich man Domenico and Filumena, a penniless prostitute, share great part of their lives in the immediate post WWII Italy.

40.name: Fail-Safe
40.description: American planes are sent to deliver a nuclear attack on Moscow, but it's a mistake due to an electrical malfunction. Can all-out war be averted?

41.name: The Incredible Mr. Limpet
41.description: Meek and mild mannered bookkeeper Henry Limpet has few passions in life. It's mid-1941 and he would love to join the Navy but has been rated 4F. His friend George Stickle is in the Navy and...                See full summary »

42.name: Viva Las Vegas
42.description: Race car driver Lucky Jackson goes to Las Vegas to earn money to pay for a new engine for his motor car. Working as a waiter, he still finds the time to court young Rusty Martin.

43.name: L'homme de Rio
43.description: A young man comes to the rescue of his girlfriend abducted by thieves and brought to Rio. An extravagant adventure ensues.

44.name: First Men in the Moon
44.description: When a spaceship lands on the moon, it is hailed as a new accomplishment, before it becomes clear that a Victorian party completed the journey in 1899, leading investigators to that mission's last survivor.

45.name: Bande à part
45.description: Two crooks with a fondness for old Hollywood B-movies convince a languages student to help them commit a robbery.

46.name: Dead Ringer
46.description: The working-class twin sister of a callous, wealthy woman impulsively murders her out of revenge and assumes her identity. But impersonating her dead twin is more complicated and risky than she anticipated.

47.name: Two Thousand Maniacs!
47.description: Six people are lured into a small Deep South town for a Centennial celebration where the residents proceed to kill them one by one as revenge for the town's destruction during the Civil War.

48.name: Robinson Crusoe on Mars
48.description: Stranded on Mars with only a monkey as a companion, an astronaut must figure out how to find oxygen, water, and food on the lifeless planet.

49.name: Roustabout
49.description: After a singer loses his job at a coffee shop, he finds employment at a struggling carnival, but his attempted romance with a teenager leads to friction with her father.

50.name: The Moon-Spinners
50.description: Travelling through Crete to collect folk songs for the BBC, a British teen and her aunt stumble upon local criminals who are peddling gems stolen from a London bank.
